original_text:
**INSTITUTION
Transfer Summary
Name :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
Acct # :
**ID-NUM
MRN :
**ID-NUM
Admitted :
**DATE[Apr 23 2007]
Discharged :
**DATE[Apr 29 2007]
Dict :
**NAME[XXX , WWW]
Attend :
**NAME[ZZZ , YYY]
PRIMARY DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Pulmonary fibrosis secondary to interferon use .
2. Pneumonia .
3. Lethargy .
4. Hepatitis C .
5. Chronic pain .
SECONDARY DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Hypothyroidism .
2. Diabetes mellitus .
3. History of recurrent ascites .
4. History of portal hypertension secondary to hepatitis C .
5. History of Clostridium difficile colitis .
TRANSFER CONDITION :
Stable .
PROCEDURES :
1. On **DATE[Apr 24 2007] , chest x-ray showed bilateral pulmonary fibrosis , unchanged , no acute cardiopulmonary change .
2. On **DATE[Apr 22 2007] , chest x-ray showed diffuse bilaterally pulmonary infiltrates or edema , unchanged .
3. On **DATE[Apr 21 2007] , chest x-ray showed bilateral interstitial fibrosis , superimposed bilateral pneumonia cannot be excluded .
CONSULTS :
Dr. **NAME[VVV UUU] ( GI ) .
REASON FOR ADMISSION :
Ms. **NAME[AAA] is a **AGE[in 40s]- year - old female with a history of hepatitis C and pulmonary fibrosis secondary to interferon treatment who is transferred from **INSTITUTION with a chief complaint of shortness of breath .
**INSTITUTION COURSE :
Ms. **NAME[AAA] is a **AGE[in 40s]- year - old female with a history of hepatitis C and pulmonary fibrosis secondary to interferon treatment who was admitted from **INSTITUTION with a chief complaint of shortness of breath .
During her admission to the outside hospital , she was noted to have pneumonia and was started on IV Zosyn and IV vancomycin for this .
In addition , she was noted to be lethargic .
For her pneumonia , we maintained her on her IV Zosyn and IV vancomycin .
She remained afebrile during her stay here .
He blood cultures showed no growth .
She was initially on 4 to 10 liters of oxygen by Oxymizer .
However , on the day of transfer , she was weaned down to 2 L of O2 by nasal cannula .
A sputum culture was ordered but was not able to be obtained .
For her pulmonary fibrosis , she was maintained on oxygen .
The patient noticed a slight improvement in her shortness of breath by the time of transfer .
She was started on albuterol , Atrovent , Imuran , and Pulmicort .
Her lethargy was thought to be secondary to narcotic overdose at the outside hospital .
While there , she received IV Dilaudid .
Upon admission to **INSTITUTION , we stopped her Dilaudid and gradually decreased her OxyContin .
By the time of discharge , she was taking 30 mg of OxyContin by mouth every 12 hours with 5 mg of oxycodone p.o. q.4 h. p.r.n. breakthrough pain .
Following a decrease of her pain medications as well as her Ativan , her mental status greatly improved .
On the day of transfer , she was sitting up in bed and was able to walk around the hallways .
She was also seen by Dr. **NAME[UUU] ( GI ) for her hepatitis and history of ascites .
We obtained ammonia levels which were slightly elevated ( from 51.9 to 97.2 ) .
Her decreased level of consciousness was not thought to be secondary to hepatic encephalopathy .
She was maintained on a low-protein diet .
She was also started on Aldactone , Lasix , lactulose , and Neomycin .
Her Aldactone was stopped by GI on the day of transfer .
At the time of transfer , the patient reports that she is still having occasional diarrhea .
For prophylaxis , she was started on SCD s as well as Protonix .
She was followed by physical therapy and occupational therapy .
For her pain , she was continued on OxyContin and oxycodone .
TRANSFER MEDICATIONS :
1. Prozac 60 mg p.o. q.a.m.
2. Oxycodone 5 mg p.o. q.3 h. p.r.n. pain .
3. DuoNeb 3 mL inhalation solution b.i.d.
4. OxyContin 30 mg p.o. q.12 h .
5. Lorazepam 1 mg p.o. nightly .
6. Vancomycin 1 g IV q.24 h .
7. Imuran 50 mg p.o. b.i.d.
8. Pulmicort 0.25 mg aerosolized b.i.d.
9. Neomycin 1000 mg p.o. q.6 h .
10. Folic acid 1 mg p.o. daily .
11. Lasix 40 mg p.o. daily .
12. Synthroid 150 mcg p.o. daily .
13. Nadolol 40 mg p.o. daily .
14. Protonix 40 mg p.o. daily .
15. Zosyn 4.5 g IV q.8 h .
16. Lactulose 20 g p.o. q.i.d.
17. Albuterol 0.5 mL aerosolized q.4 h. p.r.n.
18. Atrovent 3 mL aerosolized q.4 h. p.r.n.
TRANSFER ORDERS :
Transfer orders are as per the order form .
The patient is to continue her IV antibiotics ( vancomycin and Zosyn ) for 7 additional days .
She is to follow up with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] in one week .
Diet is low protein .
Activity is as tolerated .
Physical therapy and occupational therapy should continue to work with Ms. **NAME[AAA] .
Ms. **NAME[AAA] is to call her physician or return to the hospital should she have further shortness of breath , fever , chills , or abdominal distention .
______________________________
**NAME[WWW XXX]
HS Job # 135136 / 33115 /
SHY # **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Apr 29 2007] 15:43
T :
**DATE[Apr 29 2007] 16:43
**CARBON-COPY
